column4: do i have to install a separate package for the python gzip module? i can't seem to find anything about that
ImportError: No module named gzip
http://docs.python.org/lib/module-zlib.html
E: Couldn't find package zlib
gzip is in the standard library too I believe
they are both in the stanard lib
standard even
save me from my ignorance, do i need to apt-get something for the standard lib?
no, it should be installed with python.  What version of ubuntu are you using?
dpkg -L python2.4 | grep gzip
Package `python2.4' is not installed
but python -V returns Python 2.4.3
erm ok, what package gives you python?
i probably just installed apt-get python
I'm pretty sure python just depends on python2.4.
weird, if i run apt-get install python now it says it will install python2.4
i'm going to try  it
oh, ubuntu may just install python-minimal by default.  That will probably fix your problems
yup, that was it. thanks!
np
